Articles.Content:
And by ridiculous I mean awesome! Have you ever got anything this juicy? Post stories about your unbelievable contracts below. 

Spoiler

Disclaimer: I do use mods, but none that would alter the difficulty or reward of contracts.

That one doesn't seem very ridiculous.  Drop a telescope in orbit around the sun somewhere between Kerbin and Eve.   That's pretty easy to do and has good returns.

Getting Ore from Eve to Tylo was one I didn't expect to ever see.

6 minutes ago, Gargamel said:

That one doesn't seem very ridiculous.  Drop a telescope in orbit around the sun somewhere between Kerbin and Eve.   That's pretty easy to do and has good returns.(...)

I think the OP means the 12,000,000 reward...

And the deadline is just within two millennia! I wonder if the sentinel craft would last that long even with RTGs. Not to mention any former colonists on Eve after enduring for so long.

...and Saint Jebediah blessed the place of Eve, making her Holy, and ever watching us from His celestial temple of Kerbin.

-- Asteroids, chapter two, verse nine
Yep, it's about the reward. Do you often get contracts that earn you 12M or more? And if so, what sort of contracts?
High reward Sentinel contracts aren't too rare.  I've never seen one that high, but I generally turn my contract rewards down to 40% or less.

Getting Ore from Eve to Tylo was one I didn't expect to ever see. 

My god. The real question here is... Did you do it?! Cause' that'd be crazy.

Yep, it's about the reward. Do you often get contracts that earn you 12M or more? And if so, what sort of contracts?

I don't think I've ever gotten a contract for more than like 4M. And that was for some far out surface base I think.

18 minutes ago, James M said:

My god. The real question here is... Did you do it?! Cause' that'd be crazy.

I think I had only gotten ore from minmus, and aside from a fleet of probes to lots of places, I had only stuck my nose out into interplanetary space once to level up a bunch of kerbals, and then turned around and came home.... so no, I turned that one down in favor of more lucrative contracts.

I had one of these high paying Sentinel contracts on my PS4.  Was 4.66M up front, 7.69M reward +154 science and 252 rep to track 12 near Kerbin with an inclination of greater than 39.  It had a 977 year deadline.

What I thought was absurd about the contract wasn't so much the payout (but it did raise my eyebrows).  It was the deadline that had me wondering what.  Things like this rarely take 20 years, let alone nearly a thousand.

Yes the deadline is weirder than the reward, who is high but had some multi million ones also know that grand tour contracts can get above 10 million. 

However the requirements here are also weird, 16 astroids around Eve with an inclination higher than 37 degree. 
Not sure if this is flyby who is rare enough, but in orbit who is pretty impossible as Eve lack an large moon who can temporary trap them, they also form in Kerbin intercept orbits unless changed. 
In short it looks like you have to move them into orbit and hope the telescope spot them.
Right, I completed the contract in slightly over a year (almost two millennia before the deadline) and now I am enjoying those extra juicy 8M.

I think when these sorts of contracts are active, the stock game will start spawning asteroids near the orbit of the selected object. I finished a Kerbin scan on one stock playthrough, that resulted in a new one for Jool. Sure enough, rocks started spawning out there.

1 hour ago, Gordon Fecyk said:

I think when these sorts of contracts are active, the stock game will start spawning asteroids near the orbit of the selected object. I finished a Kerbin scan on one stock playthrough, that resulted in a new one for Jool. Sure enough, rocks started spawning out there.

Makes sense, and it also make these contracts relevant for another reason, having an asteroid base down at lower orbits of Eve had been nice.

I had decided to take one of those new comet contracts. The reward was decent, so I took it thinking that this wouldn't be too hard, right? Well... to start, it needs a surface sample from the comet, so I need a crewed mission (For context, I've sent probes to at least Duna and Eve in my current career, but no manned missions to them yet). That wouldn't be so bad, except to reach the comet on just a one way trip, I'll need an estimated 8,000 m/s. Yeah... Imma need a biiiiiig rocket. At least I've unlocked tech up to the nuclear engine, so that should help. But really, this will probably be one of my hardest contracts to date.

When I just STARTED playing career mode. I got a contract to fly by Eve before I got to the Mun.

I also had to test a BACC "Thumper" Solid Fuel Booster at 300k orbit while staging. Try getting a  LARGE booster to a high orbit with low tech.

Then there is the tourists.

I had three ships with 6 tourist each flying to Mun and Minmus at the same time once.

 

I also saved a lot of Kerbals from orbit.

Edited July 17, 2020 by kpdavatar
